alert.note: Alert for Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 02 at 11:18PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR AN ICE JAM IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 AM EST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of Northern Maine, including the following county, Aroostook. * WHEN...Until 1115 AM EST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying areas along the Aroostook River between Caribou and Fort Fairfield. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1114 PM EST, local law enforcement reported an ice jam approximately 5 to 6 miles long stretching between Fort Fairfield and Caribou. Law enforcement reports minor flooding on the Grimes Road due to backwater, Grimes Road is Closed. - Low lying areas along the Grimes Road and Route 161 will be the most likely locations to experience minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Caribou and Fort Fairfield. - For flood safety visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Water levels can rise and fall quickly in the vicinity of ice jams. Those with interests along rivers and tributary streams should be alert for rapidly fluctuating water levels in the vicinity of ice jams. Never drive through flooded roads or around closed road barricades. The barricades are there for your safety due to the potential for ice jam releases or continued flooding.
